Class Sensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sensor

  • public class Sensor
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0 In this Sensor Class, the sensor will determine whether or not there is a point within its range that is a "recognized" reference point. When a point is detected, robots' location and the estimated reference point location is saved in a file. The Sensor Class will perform calculation to determine the distance between itself (robot) and the points around it. It will "track" its location in relation to the points around it so that the Robot can determine it's own x and y location to figure out where it began on the "field".
    Author:
    Miralda Rodney

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sensor()
      This is the default constructor for the sensor method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double[] calculateRobotLocation(double rx, double ry, double sx, double sy, double distance, double sensorError)
      The method determines the robot's estimated location from the location given and the reference point with error and adds some error to the calculations
      double[] detectPoints(double rangeOfSensor, double robotX, double robotY, double sensorError, Map map)
      The detectPoints method uses the static array of randomly generated reference points from the Map class.
      double[] distanceBetweenPoints(double rx, double ry, double sx, double sy, double sensorError)
      The distanceBetweenPoints method will figure out the distance between the robot at each point and a reference point in its sensing range.
      int saveToFile(double arx, double ary, double rpx, double rpy, double dist, double erx, double ery)
      This will save the reference points detected by the sensor, the robots location when it senses the point, the distance between the robot and the reference point, and the robots estimation of its location at each instant.

        public Sensor()
        This is the default constructor for the sensor method.

    • Method Detail

      • detectPoints

        public double[] detectPoints(double rangeOfSensor,
                             double robotX,
                             double robotY,
                             double sensorError,
                             Map map)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        The detectPoints method uses the static array of randomly generated reference points from the Map class. The sensor will check the area in its scope (defined by the user) to figure out if there are any points in the vicinity. When a point is detected, the estimated location of the point is saved formatted in a file.
        Parameters:
        rangeOfSensor - user defined sensor range
        robotX - the robot's x location at each movement
        robotY - the robot's y location at each movement
        sensorError - user defined error in sensor
        map - object that contains the reference point locations
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown if the file is not found or if there is a problem writing to the file.

      • distanceBetweenPoints

        public double[] distanceBetweenPoints(double rx,
                                      double ry,
                                      double sx,
                                      double sy,
                                      double sensorError)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        The distanceBetweenPoints method will figure out the distance between the robot at each point and a reference point in its sensing range.
        Parameters:
        rx - the robot's current x location
        ry - the robot's current y location
        sx - the reference points x location
        sy - the reference points y location
        sensorError - the error in the sensor
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • calculateRobotLocation

        public double[] calculateRobotLocation(double rx,
                                       double ry,
                                       double sx,
                                       double sy,
                                       double distance,
                                       double sensorError)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        The method determines the robot's estimated location from the location given and the reference point with error and adds some error to the calculations
        Parameters:
        rx - the robot's x location
        ry - the robot's y location
        sx - the reference point x location
        sy - the reference point y location
        distance - the distance between the robot and the reference point
        sensorError - the error in the sensor
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • saveToFile

        public int saveToFile(double arx,
                      double ary,
                      double rpx,
                      double rpy,
                      double dist,
                      double erx,
                      double ery)
               throws java.io.IOException
        This will save the reference points detected by the sensor, the robots location when it senses the point, the distance between the robot and the reference point, and the robots estimation of its location at each instant.
        Parameters:
        arx - the robot's x location
        ary - the robot's y location
        rpx - the reference point x location
        rpy - the reference point y location
        dist - the distance between the robot and the reference point
        erx - the robot's estimated x location
        ery - the robot's estimated y location
        Throws:
        catches - IO exception
        java.io.IOException
